page.title: 05LIFE AT WRITTLE COLLEGE
page.content: Part of the College is on the site of an old palace belonging to King John from the 13th Century but this has since been demolished. To get into the Colege the students must have worked on a farm for at least one year. They must also have 'O' Levels for the National Diploma or 'A' Levels for the Higher National Diploma. The College day lasts from 8.45a.m.to 5p.m. with a one hour break for lunch. During the day they study either agriculture, agricultural engineering, commercial horticulture or amenity horticulture. Some of the results of these studies could lead to assistance with the construction of golf courses and sports fields.
